comments:
I am getting the following in my log


******************
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 4 0 2006-07-20 09:22:45.354
!MESSAGE An unexpected runtime error has occurred.
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.debug.Debug.printStackTrace(Debug.java:329)
        at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.resumeBundle(Framework.java:1041)
        at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.resumeBundles(StartLevelManager.java:573)
        at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.incFWSL(StartLevelManager.java:495)
        at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.doSetStartLevel(StartLevelManager.java:275)
        at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.StartLevelManager.dispatchEvent(StartLevelManager.java:455)
        at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager.dispatchEvent(EventManager.java:189)
        at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager$EventThread.run(EventManager.java:291)

***********

I believe this is the version I am using

org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.0.v20060510.jar

Created an attachment (id=46583)
patch

This can happen if BundleException.getNestedException returns null.  This patch adds a null check to Debug.printStackTrace.  It also does puts checks in the code to make sure we are passing a valid exception when we really want to print the stack trace out.  In this case if getNestedException is null then we should just pass the original BundleException.
